title: Ticket #3173: glexec cleanup fails if proxy is missing
description:
RUST ticket contents: 

> Hi Dan and Zach.
>
> I think I have found a logical bug in the Condor-glexec interface.
>
> The problem is
> condor_glexec_cleanup
>
> It fails if the user does a through cleanup of his work area at job termination, e.g. like this:
> for FILE in `find . -not -name "*stderr" -not -name "*stdout" `; do rm -rf $FILE; done
>
> The net result is a shadow exception, due to the started going belly up with
> 07/06/12 09:03:57 (pid:17055) GLExecPrivSepHelper::run_script: /data1/condor_local/execute/dir_32278/glide_f32339/main/condor/
libexec/condor_glexec_cleanup exited with status 256 and following output:
> It appears that the value of pthread_mutex_init is 651034992
> rm: cannot remove `/data1/condor_local/execute/dir_32278/glide_f32339/execute/dir_17055/x509up_u31055': No such file or direct
ory
> tar: This does not look like a tar archive
> tar: Error exit delayed from previous errors
> mv: cannot move `/data1/condor_local/execute/dir_32278/glide_f32339/execute/dir_17055.condor' to `/data1/condor_local/execute/
dir_32278/glide_f32339/execute/dir_17055/dir_17055.condor': Permission denied
>
> 07/06/12 09:03:57 (pid:17055) ERROR "error changing sandbox ownership to condor" at line 188 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_
3605/userdir/src/condor_starter.V6.1/glexec_privsep_helper.linux.cpp
>
> I think the offending code is this:
> "$GLEXEC" "$SH" -c "rm \"$SANDBOX/$PROXY\" && \
>                          tar -C \"$SANDBOX\" -c . && \
>                          rm -rf \"$SANDBOX\"" | \
>      tar -C "$SANDBOX.condor" -x
>
> I.e. if the user deletes the proxy file, everything else fails!
>
> I would argue you want to proceed even if the proxy file is not there.
remarks:
2012-Aug-01 15:38:54 by danb:
It appears that this problem was already fixed in #1760. Currently, that ticket claims to have been resolved in 7.6.1, but the commit does not appear in the 7.6 branch. It appears in the 7.7 branch.
